title: "Twitter is out of control, made possible through the government gift of Section 230!" - Trump

body: I still think they should be allowed to do whatever they want, so Section 230 makes sense to me (but I'm not sure why they would be considered responsible for their users' actions in the first place other than because everything is always someone else's fault). But people shouldn't just be letting twitter and the rest of big tech get away with this crap.
body_html: I still think they should be allowed to do whatever they want, so Section 230 makes sense to me (but I'm not sure why they would be considered responsible for their users' actions in the first place other than because everything is always someone else's fault). But people shouldn't just be letting twitter and the rest of big tech get away with this crap.

post.title: "Twitter is out of control, made possible through the government gift of Section 230!" - Trump

author.bio: Tell the Ruqqus community a bit about yourself.
author.bio_html: Tell the Ruqqus community a bit about yourself.

body:
>But people shouldn't just be letting twitter and the rest of big tech get away with this crap.

This is the problem.  I want virtually no government regulation, but part of letting the market solve problems is that we need people willing to "vote with their wallet" so to speak.  How many conservatives do you see complaining about twitter or Facebook *on twitter or Facebook*?  There are alternatives.  They're not *currently* at a Twitter or Facebook level, but they can get there if people abandon the bullshit.

Hell, make it public.  Celebrities/politicians can publicly announce that they're moving off these platforms and why.  I reckon part of why people don't believe the censorship stories is the people complaining about it stick around.
body_html:
But people shouldn't just be letting twitter and the rest of big tech get away with this crap.

This is the problem. I want virtually no government regulation, but part of letting the market solve problems is that we need people willing to "vote with their wallet" so to speak. How many conservatives do you see complaining about twitter or Facebook on twitter or Facebook? There are alternatives. They're not currently at a Twitter or Facebook level, but they can get there if people abandon the bullshit.

Hell, make it public. Celebrities/politicians can publicly announce that they're moving off these platforms and why. I reckon part of why people don't believe the censorship stories is the people complaining about it stick around.

body:
The other issue is that all those celebrities and such are in with the deep state which supports the current establishment. And people are just letting it happen.

Even if we got rid of section 230, with the way people are treating this the government would just end up doing the exact same censorship in the end.
